items.to_string:
Title: Strands lambda listed using tags and names

Value Statement: As a ml engineer I want to be able to list lambdas that will contain Strands agents to use in ARIA.

AC: Function added to api that will list all lambdas that will be used as strands agents.

Title: Invoke Lambda Strands agent from ARIA Value Statement: As a ml engineer I want to be able to invoke a strands agent within a lambda so that ARIA can interact with it AC: Strands agent in lambda used in the PI demo can be reached and return a response from the API

Value Statement: As a mlops engineer who builds tenant agnostic CICD pipelines, I need the ability to clearly define the sagemaker pipeline deployment workflow so that it has all the features needed for tenant teams using sagemaker pipelines.

Acceptance Criteria - met w/ SE's that have tenants who deploy SM pipelines - Clearly defined the inputs and outputs - Mapped out detailed deployment workflow that works for all tenant use cases - Received approval from lead and SE w/ most complex SM pipeline deployment workflow

Value Statement: As a mlops engineer who builds tenant agnostic pipelines, I need to add a deployment module for sagemaker pipelines into mlkit so that the deployment workflow can be easily imported and extended

Acceptance Criteria - deployment module created in mlkit for sagemaker pipelines - mlkit CLI command aded to deploy sagemaker pipelines - tested with at least one real deployment
This issue is cloned by BIP-30659

items.from_string: Create inputset for SPA - for unified Lambda pipeline
items.to_string:
Create inputset for SPA - for unified Lambda pipeline
Value Statement: As a BIP AI SE I want a specific input set for SPA for the unified Lambda pipeline that captures all required parameters and orchestrates calls to the Image Builder Lambda and the Lambda deployment pipeline So that SPA can execute a consistent, repeatable build-and-deploy workflow with minimal manual configuration.
 
AC: Create a new Input Set named for SPA that can be selected when running the lambda code deployment pipeline

Value statement: As a platform/DevOps team member I want a clear, standardized operating procedure for using Harness to build, deploy, and manage releases So that deployments are consistent, secure, repeatable, and easy to support across environments and tenants.
AC: Create a documented SOP that defines how the team should use Harness end-to-end, including: Pipeline and template standards Environment promotion process (Stage → Preprod → Prod) Approvals/governance gates Delegate usage, troubleshooting, and operational checks Rollback and incident response steps Required training/onboarding steps for engineers

Value Statement: As a platform/DevOps team member I want a clear, standardized operating procedure for using Harness to build, deploy, and manage releases So that deployments are consistent, secure, repeatable, and easy to support across environments and tenants.

As a DevOps engineer, I want to programmatically verify that the Stage connector used for Nexus in Harness is working and configured with the correct credentials, so that my pipeline can reliably interact with our Nexus registry
This issue is cloned by BIP-30340

Title: Update Batch Inference Example notebook with optimized performance

items.from_string:
Title: Design evaluation framework for LLMs that can be used for tenants

Value Statement: As an MLOps Engineer evaluating agent performance, I want to design the evaluation framework to be used for tenants.

AC: Using info from design research,  plan out how to evaluate all metrics outlined. 
Create a design for each type of agentic use case tenants are currently using - RAG, tool use, simple bedrock calls
Determine applicable datasets and gather if necessary. 
Create architecture diagrams of each type of experiment.
items.to_string:
Title: Design evaluation framework for LLMs that can be used for tenants

Value Statement: As an MLOps Engineer evaluating agent performance, I want to design the evaluation framework to be used for tenants.

AC: Identify key evaluative touchpoints in the tenant MLOps lifecycle (selection, pre-prod, and post-deployment monitoring).
Design a framework to evaluate and compare base models (e.g., Bedrock vs. Anthropic, Llama versions) for specific tenant use cases.
Plan a test suite for pre-prod evaluation, including support for automated pipeline runs and offline experiments.
Design evaluation framework for RAG, tool use, and multi-agent systems.
Produce diagrams and descriptions showing how/where tenants leverage BIP AI tools to standardize the GenAI SDLC.

Value Statement: As a mlops engineer who contributes to the mlkit library, I need the ability to be able to add the DYnamoDB batch writer from the ratings sum code base so that tenants can have an optimized way to perform bulk updates on dynamodb tables Acceptance Criteria: - Reviewed the ratings sum dynamo client - Determined bulk updated functionality that can be added to the mlkit dynamo client - Flagged additional funcitonality from the ratings sum dynamo client that would be useful in mlkit (if any) - Added unit tests as needed - Tested using a bulk update of 10k+ records

AC: Update existing documentation (https://confluence.devops.va.gov/display/VAExternal/Research%3A+Bedrock+Evaluations+for+Model+Performance+Metrics
& 
https://confluence.devops.va.gov/display/VAExternal/Guide%3A+AWS+Bedrock+Agent+Evaluation) 
- Add metrics for agent evaluation (tool use accuracy, task completion rate, latency, tokens used) 
- Analysis of evaluation frameworks to use - AWS owned, open source, custom

Value Statement: As an MLOps Engineer evaluating LLMs and agents, I want to document methods to evaluate agent performance.

AC: Create documentation for the following:
- Add metrics for agent evaluation (tool use accuracy, task completion rate, latency, tokens used)
- Analysis of evaluation frameworks to use - AWS owned, open source, custom

items.from_string: Deploy Go Crossplane Manager to SBX Management for gateway and resources view validation
items.to_string:
Deploy Go Crossplane Manager to SBX Management for gateway and resources view validation

Story: As a BIP-AI Infrastructure Engineer, I want to deploy our Go-based Crossplane manager and MFE into the SBX Management cluster so that we validate the gateway routing and All Resources view and prepare for rapid iterations of the manager/worker model. Assumptions: - SBX Management cluster access is available for deploy and test - Manager and MFE container images are built and accessible from the registry - Required configuration (secrets, environment settings, gateway/ingress) is available or provisioned Acceptance Criteria: - Given SBX Management cluster access when I deploy the Go Crossplane manager and MFE then all pods reach Ready and services report healthy status - Given the gateway configuration when the MFE is deployed then the gateway route responds HTTP 200 and serves the application UI - Given the MFE application when I navigate to the All Resources view then resources load successfully and reflect the current Crossplane-managed state - Given the manager connection to Crossplane when reconciliation runs then no errors appear in logs and basic list/read operations succeed - Given the deployment in SBX Management when I run smoke tests then gateway routing and All Resources view checks pass Definition of Done: - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (unit/integration as applicable) - Documentation updated (README / runbook / API docs as applicable) - Telemetry / logging added (if applicable) - Security and access controls reviewed (if applicable) - Dependencies updated and migrations applied (if applicable) - Feature flag (if used) enabled or removal plan noted

items.from_string: Research XPKG packaging to enable composition-level versioning and decoupled releases
items.to_string:
Research XPKG packaging to enable composition-level versioning and decoupled releases

Story: As a BIP-AI Engineer, I want to evaluate Crossplane packages (XPKG) for delivering specific versions of our compositions and XRDs so that I can version control and release changes granularly without forcing unrelated updates. Assumptions: - SBX cluster access is available for package installation and testing - Necessary tooling (crossplane CLI or build tooling) and registry access are available - A minimal dummy composition/XRD (e.g., single bucket resource) is acceptable for testing Acceptance Criteria: - Given current Crossplane/XPKG documentation when I review and summarize then a document exists in bip-ai-infrastructure describing packaging, versioning, and deployment for small composition/XRD groups - Given a dummy composition and XRD when I build an XPKG locally then the package builds successfully with a semantic version tag and is ready to push to a registry - Given SBX cluster access when I install the test XPKG then the XRD and Composition are available and a single-resource (bucket) reconciles successfully - Given the independent package installation when I deploy only the test composition then no other compositions/XRDs change and cluster health remains stable - Given the research outcomes when I document the process then the repository contains a step-by-step runbook including tooling, commands, and rollback guidance - Given a defined approach when I create a follow-on ticket then the ticket outlines next steps for adopting XPKGs and links the documentation Definition of Done: - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (unit/integration as applicable) - Documentation updated (README / runbook / API docs as applicable) - Telemetry / logging added (if applicable) - Security and access controls reviewed (if applicable) - Dependencies updated and migrations applied (if applicable) - Feature flag (if used) enabled or removal plan noted

items.from_string: Refactor compositions A–G to use global environment config for XPKG readiness
items.to_string:

Story: As a BIP-AI Engineer, I want to evaluate Crossplane packages (XPKG) for delivering specific versions of our compositions and XRDs so that I can version control and release changes granularly without forcing unrelated updates. Assumptions: - SBX cluster access is available for package installation and testing - Necessary tooling (crossplane CLI or build tooling) and registry access are available - A minimal dummy composition/XRD (e.g., single bucket resource) is acceptable for testing Acceptance Criteria: - Given current Crossplane/XPKG documentation when I review and summarize then a document exists in bip-ai-infrastructure describing packaging, versioning, and deployment for small composition/XRD groups - Given a dummy composition and XRD when I build an XPKG locally then the package builds successfully with a semantic version tag and is ready to push to a registry - Given SBX cluster access when I install the test XPKG then the XRD and Composition are available and a single-resource (bucket) reconciles successfully - Given the independent package installation when I deploy only the test composition then no other compositions/XRDs change and cluster health remains stable - Given the research outcomes when I document the process then the repository contains a step-by-step runbook including tooling, commands, and rollback guidance - Given a defined approach when I create a follow-on ticket then the ticket outlines next steps for adopting XPKGs and links the documentation Definition of Done: - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (unit/integration as applicable) - Documentation updated (README / runbook / API docs as applicable) - Telemetry / logging added (if applicable) - Security and access controls reviewed (if applicable) - Dependencies updated and migrations applied (if applicable) - Feature flag (if used) enabled or removal plan noted

items.from_string:
Title: Remake AI team API Metrics Grafana dashboard

### Value Statement As a platform engineer monitoring system health and performance, I need a unified Grafana dashboard that displays API metrics from all AI team microservices so that I can quickly identify issues, track performance trends, and ensure service reliability across the platform.

### Acceptance Criteria When a user views the AI team API Metrics Grafana dashboard, the dashboard displays comprehensive metrics from all AI team microservices with proper visualization and alerting capabilities. - Dashboard pulls metrics data from gateway microservice and mfes - Dashboard pulls metrics data from crossplane-manager microservice - Dashboard pulls metrics data from mlops-manager microservice - API request rates, latencies, and error rates are visualized for each service - HTTP status code distributions are displayed per service - Resource utilization metrics (CPU, memory, connections) are included - Dashboard includes appropriate time range selectors and refresh intervals - Panels are organized logically by service and metric type - Alerts are configured for critical thresholds (high error rates, elevated latencies) - Dashboard is deployed to all environments (dev, sbx, stage, preprod) - Documentation includes dashboard usage guide and metric definitions
items.to_string:
Value Statement
Integrating the custom Fortify image into the BIP AI Image Builder pipeline will reduce scan execution time from the current 14-25 minutes closer to the Jenkins baseline of 3 minutes. By replacing the Accelerators managed image with our custom pre-built image, we eliminate repeated package installation time (estimated 4+ minute reduction), improving developer productivity and reducing compute costs while maintaining all existing security scanning functionality.Acceptance Criteria *  BIP AI Image Builder pipeline run step updated to reference custom Fortify image from Nexus/ECR
 *  Fortify scan execution time reduced by minimum of 4 minutes compared to current baseline
 *  All existing Fortify scan functionality verified with no regressions in security checks
 *  Performance metrics documented comparing before/after execution times

items.from_string:
*Value Statement:* As an infra engineer I need to fix the issue preventing NPM packages from the BIP Nexus NPM repo from being pulled during the build pipeline.

*AC:* The bip-ai-mlops-mfe is able to be successfully built with the BIP AI Image Builder Pipeline.
 #  

 #
items.to_string:
Value Statement
Building a custom Fortify image with pre-installed language dependencies will eliminate redundant package installations during each scan. Currently, the Fortify scan process spends significant time installing packages for Python, Java, Node.js, and Go on every pipeline run. By creating a reusable image with these dependencies pre-installed and storing it in Nexus or ECR, we can reduce repeated installation overhead and prepare for faster pipeline execution times.Acceptance Criteria *  Custom Docker image built with pre-installed Fortify dependencies for commonly used languages (Python, Java, Node.js, Go)
 *  Image successfully stored in approved registry (Nexus or ECR) and accessible by Harness pipelines
 *  Documentation created for image contents, build process, and maintenance procedures
 *  Image validated to include all necessary dependencies for standard Fortify scans
This issue is cloned by BIP-30351
